paper_abstract: A connected graph G is optimal-kappa if kappa(G) = delta(G). It is super-kappa if every minimum vertex cut isolates a vertex. An Optimal-kappa graph G is m-optimal-kappa if for any vertex set S subset of V(G) with vertical bar S vertical bar <= m, G - S is still optimal-kappa. We define the vertex fault tolerance with respect to optimal-kappa, denoted by O(kappa)(G), as the maximum integer m such that G is m-optimal-kappa. The concept of vertex fault tolerance with respect to super-kappa, denoted by S(kappa) (G), is defined in a similar way. In this paper, we show that min{kappa(1)(G) - delta(G), delta(G) - 1} <= O(kappa) (G) <= delta(G) - 1 and min{kappa(1)(G) - delta(G) - 1, delta(G) - 1} <= S(kappa)(G) <= delta(G) - 1, where K(1)(G) is the 1-extra connectivity of G. Furthermore, when the graph is triangle free, more refined lower bound can be derived for O(kappa)(G). (c) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Vertex fault tolerance of optimal-kappa graphs and super-kappa graphs
